metadata.Title: CVE-2014-7817 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The wordexp function in GNU C Library (aka glibc) 2.21 does not enforce the WRDE_NOCMD flag, which allows context-dependent attackers to execute arbitrary commands, as demonstrated by input containing "$((`...`))".

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-7817` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

eglibc-source - 2.19-0ubuntu6.4
libc-bin - 2.19-0ubuntu6.4
libc6 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.4
libc6-amd64 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.4
libc6-armel - 2.19-0ubuntu6.4
libc6-i386 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.4
libc6-pic - 2.19-0ubuntu6.4
libc6-ppc64 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.4
libc6-prof - 2.19-0ubuntu6.4
libc6-x32 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.4
multiarch-support - 2.19-0ubuntu6.4
nscd - 2.19-0ubuntu6.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: eglibc package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.19-0ubuntu6.4').
